column4: hey, i connect my usbdrive to ubuntu. the drive is found by ubuntu. but the size is wrong. it shows the drive as much smaller then it is. is there a way to get ubuntu to udate the drive size?
How much smaller is it?
its originally 4gb but shows as 1.3gb i believe
hmm... I'm not sure
pici, it says 13811 items, totalling 1.5 GB'
and free space 49.9 MB
the drive is really a sony ericsson w950 with a 4gb built in extra drive. it works as a usb drive when connected to a computer with a usb cable
pici but the real free size is something above 2gb. at least
Check dmesg when you plug it in, see what it says the size is
you should see something like "SCSI device sda: 3940352 512-byte hdwr sectors (2017 MB)"
pici what would i write to see that?
pici did i miss something you wrote?
open a terminal, put the usb stick in then type dmesg
pici  SCSI device sdb: 8026112 512-byte hdwr sectors (4109 MB)
pici so its nautilus showing me wrong numbers
Sounds like it, what do you get as the size if you type df -h in a terminal?
pici is there a shortcut to get a terminal up in ubuntu? :P sry i think i saw one guy do that once. didnt catch the shortcut though
in gnome its under accessories in the menu
pici '/dev/sdb1  3.8G  3.8G   50M  99% /media/Acke'
i meant more like a keyboard shortcut
It looks like you only have 50mb free, but otherwise its recognizing it as the correct size
The totalling 1.5 gb is probably just in the root folder of the directory, not including any items in subfolders
pici i see.
If you have any more issues, you may need to ask someone else.  I'm leaving my computer now, goodluck!
